message: so if I create a group and mark it private, others can still see that the group exists and that I am in it?
I agree a private group should be totally private. If someone stumbles across the URL they should see the name of the group and have an opportunity to join but that's it. (IMO)
Shady shady if you need to be off the map no point for it
@mihasya yes, others can see the group and who is in it, even if it's private.
well. right now private groups are not really... private. i would also prefer to not list private groups at all.
@italiano40 don't you mean there's no point being private if you can't be shady?
Should be a way to turn off your private group's listing.  Also invite only will be good.
Say I have a product xsecretnamex that I don't want released yet, but want to chat about.  The minute it goes on Convore as a private group, you know the name and description.

@psytek I agree. I would also like to see read-only groups where anyone can see the conversations but they must be invited to post to the group. In your example there might come a time when you want interested parties to be able to monitor the conversation but not to participate. It's all about control and options. IMO convore is a good communications platform and with just a few more options it could be great.
